meanings.definition: In a manner relating to or characteristic of the time before recorded history.
meanings.sent1: The cavemen prehistorically painted on the walls of their caves.
meanings.sent2: She studied the ancient artifacts prehistorically found in the desert.
meanings.sent3: The professor jokingly claimed he prehistorically used a stone tablet for his lecture notes.
meanings.sent4: Her love for history made her feel prehistorically connected to the past.
meanings.sent5: The documentary vividly portrayed how prehistorically humans lived.

meanings.definition: During or relating to the period before written records.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologists discovered prehistorically crafted tools in the excavation site.
meanings.sent2: The prehistorically built structures amazed the researchers.
meanings.sent3: The prehistorically decorated pottery was displayed in the museum.
meanings.sent4: The prehistorically inspired artwork captured the essence of ancient times.
meanings.sent5: The prehistorically aged bones revealed secrets of the past.
